Some New Results on Inverse Sorting Problems
publication.abstract: In this paper, we consider two types of inverse sorting prob- lems. The first type is an inverse sorting problem under weighted Ham- ming distance with bound constraints, which can be solved in O(n2) time. The second type is a family of partial inverse sorting problems which we can further divide into two kinds, with free positions and with fixed

The inverse 1median problem on a cycle
publication.abstract: Let the graph G = (V;E) be a cycle with n+1 vertices, nonnega- tive vertex weights and positive edge lengths. The inverse 1-median problem on a cycle consists in changing the vertex weights at minimum cost such that a prespecifled vertex becomes the 1-median. The cost is proportional to the increase or decrease of the corresponding weight. We show that

publication.keyword: Binary Search;Inverse Problem;Maximum Weight Matching;Network Optimization;Perfect Match;Polynomial Algorithm;Polynomial Time;Linear Program;
publication.abstract: As far as we know, for most polynomially solvable network optimization problems, their inverse problems under l1 or l∞ norm have been studied, except the inverse maximum-weight matching problem in non-bipartite networks. In this paper we discuss the inverse problem of maximum-weight perfect matching in a non-bipartite network under l1 and l∞ norms. It has been proved that the inverse

Partial inverse assignment problems under l1 norm
publication.keyword: Assignment Problem;Combinatorial Optimization Problem;Inverse Problem;Polynomial Algorithm;
publication.abstract: Abstract In this paper, we consider the partial inverse assignment problem under l1 norm without bound constraints. We show that the partial inverse problem,can be solved by a strongly polynomial algorithm. The technique for solving this problem,can be extended to handle a special type of partial inverse 0.1 combinatorial optimization problems. © 2006 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved. publication.title: Optimal space-time transceiver design for selective wireless broadcast with channel state information
publication.authors: a. m. sayeed,b. d. van veen
publication.keyword: Channel State Information;Code Division Multiple Access;Indexing Terms;Satisfiability;Signal To Noise Ratio;Space Time Block Code;Spatial Diversity;Wireless Systems;Linear Program;Space Time;
publication.abstract: Abstract, Selective broadcast schemes for point-to-multiple point transmission of identical information to several selected users are studied for a code-division multiple-access wireless system. The channel states for all selected users are assumed known at both the transmitter and the receivers. The goal is to minimize total transmit power while satisfying minimum received signal-to-noise ratio (SNR) requirements. Three designs, namely, time-only,

publication.title: Reduced-state MIMO sequence detection with application to EDGE systems
publication.authors: a. m. sayeed,b. d. van veen
publication.keyword: Indexing Terms;Low Complexity;mimo system;Minimum Mean Square Error;Multiple Input Multiple Output;Numerical Simulation;Set Partitions;Temporal Processing;Delayed Decision Feedback Sequence Estimator;Reduced State Sequence Estimation;Single Input Single Output;Space Time;
publication.abstract: Abstract, In this paper we propose a joint reduced-state se-quence detector (JRSSD) for a multiple-input multiple-output (MIMO) system. The proposed JRSSD incorporates the set-par-titioning principle to obtain a reduced-state trellis and is the space-time extension of the RSSD proposed in [1] for a single-input single-output (SISO) equalization problem. We show that two elements are essential in achieving the desired complexity

publication.jconf: International Symposium on Imprecise Probabilities and Their Applications
publication.abstract: Uncertainty is a key issue in decision analysis and other kinds of applications. Researchers have developed a number of approaches to address computations on uncertain quantities. When doing arithmetic operations on random variables, an important question has to be considered: the dependency relationships among the variables. In practice, we often have partial information about the dependency relationship between two random

publication.title: Statool: A Tool for Distribution Envelope Determination (DEnv), an Interval-Based Algorithm for Arithmetic on Random Variables

Bounding the times to failure of 2component systems
publication.keyword: Indexing Terms;Model Uncertainty;Partial Information;Random Variable;Uncertainty Quantification;
publication.abstract: Characterizing the distribution of times to failure in 2-component systems is an important special case of a more general problem, finding the distribution of a function of random variables. Advances in this area are relevant to reliability as well as other fields, and influential papers on the topic have appeared in the reliability field over a span of many years.
